block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Weekly, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
MUSIC AND DANCE
Babylon The Blue Vipers of Brooklyn, American music from 1910 to 1930. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Astoria Federal Savings Bank, 180 Main Street. (631) 669-1810.
Bay Shore The Stanton Anderson Band, rock. Friday at 8 p.m. $20. Steve Forbert, folk. May 12 at 8 p.m. $25. Boulton Center for the Performing Arts, 37 West Main Street. (631) 969-1101.
Brookville Handel's ''Joshua,'' presented by the Great Neck Choral Society. May 6 at 4 p.m. $20. St. Paul the Apostle Roman Catholic Church, Cedar Swamp Road. (516) 536-0451.

Brookville Mother's Day Concert, presented by the Nassau-Suffolk Concert Band and Wind Symphony. May 13 at 7 p.m. $20; seniors and students, $10. Tilles Center for the Performing Arts, 720 Northern Boulevard, C. W. Post Campus, Long Island University. (516) 299-3100.
Dix Hills Spring Concert, presented by the Five Towns College's Choir and Concert Band. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. $10. Dix Hills Center for the Performing Arts, 305 North Service Road. (631) 656-2148.
Farmingdale Badfish, Sublime tribute band. May 6 at 6 p.m. $15 to $17. Crazy Donkey, 1058 Route 110. (631) 753-1975.
Garden City Adelphi University Chorus, directed by Michael Hume. Monday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Ruth S. Harley University Center, 1 South Avenue, Adelphi University. (516) 877-4555.
Huntington Michelle Shocked, singer-songwriter. Friday at 8 p.m. $37.50. Inter-Media Art Center, 370 New York Avenue. (631) 549-2787.

Lynbrook The Rockaway Five Towns Orchestra, directed by José Alejandro Guzman, with Hayley Kobilinsky, soprano. May 12 at 8 p.m. $10; seniors and students, $5. Lynbrook High School, 9 Union Avenue. (516) 365-6857.
Massapequa Park Buddy Merriam and Back Roads, bluegrass. Monday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Massapequa Public Library, 40 Harbor Lane. (516) 799-0770.
Port Jefferson Rudy Perrone, guitar. May 6 at 7:30 p.m. $25. Theater Three, 412 Main Street. (631) 928-9100.

Port Washington ''The Song Is You: The Songs of Jerome Kern,'' performed by various artists. May 12 at 8 p.m. $30 and $35. Jeanne Rimsky Theater at the Landmark on Main Street, 232 Main Street. (516) 767-6444.
Sayville The Kalichstein-Laredo-Robinson Trio, with Michael Tree, viola. May 12 at 8 p.m. $30. Sayville Middle School, Johnson Avenue. (631) 224-5420.
Upton Alexis P. Suter Band, blues. Friday at 6:30 p.m. $10. Brookhaven National Laboratory, County Road 46. (631) 344-3846.

West Islip ''Spring Celebration,'' presented by the West Islip Symphony Orchestra, with Jason Dobranski, cello. May 6 at 3 p.m. $10; students, free. Beach Street Middle School, 17 Beach Street. (631) 661-8348.
Westbury Brian McKnight, soul. May 13 at 7 p.m. $56.50 and $66.50. North Fork Theater, 960 Brush Hollow Road. (516) 334-0800.
OUTDOORS

Bridgehampton ''Orioles, Tanagers and Brightly Colored Warblers,'' bird walk led by Hugh McGuinness. May 12 at 7:30 a.m. $7; members, $5; registration required. South Fork Natural History Museum, 377 Bridgehampton/Sag Harbor Turnpike. (631) 537-9735.
Hempstead Dutch Festival; tulip viewing, face painting, music, dance, crafts and Dutch food and beverages. May 6, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. $3. Hofstra University South Campus, (516) 463-6644.

Huntington ''Birds and Botany for Beginners,'' adult nature program; bring binoculars. May 6 at 9:30 a.m. $3; reservations required. Caumsett State Historic Park, 25 Lloyd Harbor Road. (631) 423-1770.

Long Beach ''International Bird Migration Day,'' adult program to learn about the impact of global warming on bird populations and migration. May 12 at 8 a.m. $3; reservations required. Theodore Roosevelt Nature Center, Ocean Parkway. (516) 679-7254.

Smithtown ''Bird and Breakfast,'' birding basics and continental breakfast followed by observation walk. May 6 at 9 a.m. $3; reservations required. Caleb Smith State Park Preserve, Jericho Turnpike. (631) 265-1054.
FILM
Lawrence Jewish Film Festival: ''Go For Zucker,'' directed by Dani Levy; in German with English subtitles. Monday at 1 and 8 p.m. Free. Peninsula Public Library, 280 Central Avenue. (516) 239-3262.
Northport ''An Inconvenient Truth,'' directed by Davis Guggenheim; followed by discussion. Tuesday at 7 p.m. Free. Northport Public Library, 151 Laurel Avenue. (631) 261-6930.

Southampton ''Nobody Knows,'' directed by Hirokazu Kore-eda; in Japanese with English subtitles. Friday at 7 p.m. $7; members, $5. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118, Extension 32.
Westhampton Beach Finest in World Cinema Series: ''Avenue Montaigne,'' directed by Danièle Thompson. May 6. $3 to $10. Westhampton Beach Performing Arts Center, 76 Main Street. (631) 288-1500.
THEATER

Brentwood ''Flowers From the Ashes,'' performed by Godsongs Group Productions, youth theater group. Friday at 8 p.m. and May 12 at 1 and 7 p.m. $5; seniors and children under 10, $3. Brentwood Presbyterian Church, 125 Second Street. (631) 398-1191.

East Farmingdale ''Blood Moon,'' by Nicholas Kazan. Through June 3. $18 and $22. ''Another Antigone,'' by A. R. Gurney, presented by the Arena Players Repertory Theater. Through May 13. $16 to $22. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.
Islip ''Proof'' by David Auburn, presented by the Synergy Ensemble Theater Company. Through May 12. $5; seniors, $3. Islip Town Hall Theater, 401 Main Street. (631) 224-5430.
Patchogue ''The Waverly Gallery,'' by Kenneth Lonergan. Through May 12. $14; seniors and students, $12. Clare Rose Theater, St. Joseph's College, Suffolk Campus. (631) 654-0199.
SPOKEN WORD

Centerport ''Perpetual Motion: Revolutions in 17th-Century Science With Music,'' presented by Dava Sobel, author of ''The Planets,'' with Galileo's Daughters, period music. May 12 at 7:30 p.m. $30. Vanderbilt Museum, 180 Little Neck Road. (631) 854-5539.

Cold Spring Harbor ''Nazi Art Looting: Tales of Discovery,'' lecture presented by Evie Joselow, art historian and appraiser. May 12 at 3 p.m. Free. Cold Spring Harbor Library, 95 Harbor Road. (631) 692-6820.
Greenport Randy Duchaine, author of ''New York Waters: Profiles From the Edge.'' Thursday at 1 p.m. Free. Floyd Memorial Library, 539 First Street. (631) 477-0660.
Port Jefferson ''The Julia Wars,'' by William Wright, directed by Anthony Harvey; staged reading. May 12 at 3 p.m. Free. Theater Three, 412 Main Street. (631) 928-9100.
Stony Brook Paul Salsini, author of ''The Cielo: A Novel of Wartime Tuscany.'' Thursday at 1 p.m. Free. Center for Italian Studies Meeting Hall, Stony Brook University. (631) 632-7444.
FOR CHILDREN
East Farmingdale ''Velveteen Rabbit,'' adapted from the story by Margery Williams. Through May 27. $8. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.

Garden City ''Museum Row Family Festival,'' outdoor activities, vehicle display, puppets, food and games; co-hosted by the Cradle of Aviation and the Nassau County Firefighters Museum. All ages. May 6, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. $10. Seventh Annual Folk Arts Series Family Program: learn Indian folk dance and singing with teachers. Ages 4 and up. May 6 at 11 a.m. $5; $3 with museum admission. Classical and Bollywood dance performed by the Young Indian Cultural Group. Ages 4 and up. May 6 at 1 p.m. $5; $3 with museum admission. ''Young Naturalists Club,'' learn about soils and water. Ages 6 to 11. May 12 at 2:30 p.m. $3 with museum admission, $2 for members. Long Island Children's Museum, 11 Davis Avenue. (516) 224-5800.

Huntington ''International Migratory Bird Day,'' learn how environmental changes affect migratory birds. All ages. May 12 at 2 p.m. $3; children, $2; reservations required. Caumsett State Historic Park, 25 Lloyd Harbor Road. (631) 423-1770.

Huntington ''Sheep to Shawl Festival,'' demonstrations of sheep shearing and weaving, petting zoo, crafts, food and entertainment. All ages. May 6, noon to 4 p.m. Free. Daniel Kissam House Museum, 434 Park Avenue. (631) 427-7045, Extension 401.
Lindenhurst ''Aladdin,'' children's theater followed by a tea party. Saturdays through May 19. $8; $20 for show and tea party. Studio Theater, 141 South Wellwood Avenue. (631) 581-2700.

Oakdale ''Windcatchers,'' learn about wind through games and activities. Ages 5 and up. ''International Migratory Bird Day,'' learn how environmental changes affect migratory birds. All ages. May 12 at 9:30 a.m. Both: $3; children, $2; reservations required. Connetquot River State Park, Sunrise Highway. (631) 581-1005.

Roslyn Harbor ''Family Arbor Day,'' family tours of the grounds and gardens, tree planting and educational activities. All ages. May 6, 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Free. Nassau County Museum of Art, 1 Museum Drive. (516) 484-9337.

Smithtown ''International Migratory Bird Day,'' learn how environmental changes effect migratory birds. All ages. May 12 at 1:30 p.m. $3; children, $2; reservations required. Caleb Smith State Park Preserve, Jericho Turnpike. (631) 265-1054.

Southampton Spring Family Festival: Performance by Lelavision Physical Music, arts projects and refreshments. May 12, 1 to 4 p.m. Free. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118, Extension 32.
Stony Brook Lazer Vaudeville; juggling, acrobatics, magic and lasers. May 6 at 1 and 4 p.m. $10. Staller Center for the Arts, Stony Brook University. (631) 632-2787.

Westhampton Beach ''Willy Wonka,'' adapted from the book by Roald Dahl by Leslie Bricusse, Anthony Newley and Tim McDonald, presented by the Kennedy Center Imagination Celebration on Tour. All ages. May 12 at 7 p.m. Westhampton Beach Performing Arts Center, 76 Main Street. (631) 288-1500.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES
Amagansett Fine Art and Craft Show, presented by the South Fork Craftsmen's Guild. May 12 and 13, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Free. Miss Amelia's Cottage Museum, Highway 27A and Windmill Lane. (631) 726-2777.

Bellport ''Views and Vistas,'' works by Eleanor Duncker and Jackie Gannon. Through May 27. Reception: May 6, 1 to 3 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4:30 p.m. Phoenix Gallery, 139 Main Street. (631) 776-0811.

East Islip ''Surface Impressions,'' works by artists exploring the idea of surface in canvas, sculpture and mixed media. Through June 3. Donation: $3. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Islip Art Museum, 50 Irish Lane. (631) 224-5402.

Huntington ''Your Best Shot,'' juried photography exhibition. Through May 27. Free. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 9 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fotofoto Gallery, 372 New York Avenue. (631) 549-0448.

Huntington Station ''Head to Head,'' paintings by Ennid Berger. May 12 through June 22. Reception: May 12, 2 to 4 p.m. Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Fridays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. South Huntington Public Library, 145 Pidgeon Hill Road. (631) 549-4411.

Rockville Centre ''Irrevocable,'' works by graduating senior art students. May 6 through June 30. Free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Molloy College Art Gallery, 1000 Hempstead Avenue. (516) 678-5000.

Roslyn Harbor ''Rembrandt to Rosenquist: The Masters of Printmaking.'' Through May 13. ''Twenty-First Century Prints,'' works by Elizabeth Peyton, John Currin and other contemporary printmakers. Through May 13. Admission: $4 to $10; children under 5 and members, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Nassau County Museum of Art, 1 Museum Drive. (516) 484-9337.

Sea Cliff ''Something Old, Something New, Vintage Wedding Gowns on View,'' gowns and accessories from the 1870s to the 1950s. Through July 4. Donation. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 2 to 5 p.m. Sea Cliff Museum, 95 10th Avenue. (516) 671-0090.

Setauket ''Focus on Photography,'' works by Karen Bell, Abby Rust, Neil Scholl, Tom Steele and Jo-Anne Wilson. May 6 through June 3. Reception: May 6, 2 to 5 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Gallery North, 90 North Country Road. (631) 751-2676.

Southampton ''Raymond Loewy: Designs for a Consumer Culture,'' works by the 20th-century industrial designer. Through May 27. $7; seniors and students, $5; children under 18, free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118, Extension 32.

Stony Brook ''Living the American Dream: Levittown and the Suburban Boom,'' exhibition exploring the history of suburbanization on Long Island. Through July 8. ''William Sidney Mount: The Education of an Artist,'' Mount paintings are paired with works that inspired them. Through Sept. 30. $7; seniors, $6; students, $3. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, 1200 Route 25A. (631) 751-0066.

Huntington Station ''Head to Head,'' paintings by Ennid Berger. May 12 through June 22. (631) 549-4411.
